property.name: templeton.hcat
property.description: The path to the hcatalog executable.

property.name: templeton.libjars
property.description: Jars to add to the classpath.

property.name: templeton.pig.archive
property.description: The path to the Pig archive.

property.name: templeton.pig.path
property.description: The path to the Pig executable.

property.name: templeton.hive.archive
property.description: The path to the Hive archive.

property.name: templeton.hive.path
property.description: The path to the Hive executable.

property.name: templeton.hive.home
property.description: The path to the Hive home within the tar. This is needed if Hive is not installed on all nodes in the cluster and needs to be shipped to the target node in the cluster to execute Pig job which uses HCat, Hive query, etc.

property.name: templeton.hcat.home
property.description: The path to the HCat home within the tar. This is needed if Hive is not installed on all nodes in the cluster and needs to be shipped to the target node in the cluster to execute Pig job which uses HCat, Hive query, etc.

property.name: templeton.sqoop.archive
property.description: This should point to Sqoop tar that will be shipped to target node executing the actual sqoop command. If not set, Sqoop is expected to be installed on every node of the cluster.

property.name: templeton.sqoop.path
property.description: The path to the Sqoop executable.

property.name: templeton.sqoop.home
property.description: The path to the Sqoop home in the exploded archive.

property.name: templeton.mapper.memory.mb
property.description: Templeton controller job's Launch mapper's memory limit in megabytes. When submitting controller job, Templeton will overwrite mapreduce.map.memory.mb with this value. If empty, Templeton will not set mapreduce.map.memory.mb when submitting the controller job, therefore the configuration in mapred-site.xml will be used.
